seo.h1_title: Indonesia's Bali & Lombok: Ubud, Gili Islands & Mount Rinjani Trek
seo.intro_paragraph: Begin in Ubud, then cross Sidemen and its terraced rice paddies. Explore Amed and its black volcanic sands, then take the ferry to Gili Air and its turquoise lagoons. Speed to Kuta Lombok and its wild beaches, then end at Uluwatu and its clifftop temples. Jungle, ocean and tradition hold hands.
seo.seo_hook: Ancient temples beneath the canopy, volcanic slopes plunging into turquoise waters, breezes carrying gamelan echoes. Bali and Lombok, spirituality and wonder.
featured_list: Gili Air: turquoise lagoon snorkel paradise

seo.h1_title: The Perfect Bali Itinerary: A Journey Through Rice Terraces, Temples & Volcanoes
seo.intro_paragraph: Let Seminyak pulse between beach clubs and cosmopolitan energy, then climb toward Uluwatu and its sea cliffs. Cross Denpasar and its markets, then breathe in Canggu and its bohemian creativity. End in Sidemen in the peace of rice terraces, where time slows down.
seo.seo_hook: Beach clubs pulsing until dawn, clifftop temples kissed by spray, rice paddies rippling peace. Bali in all its magic.

seo.h1_title: Indonesia Highlights: Bali, Lombok & Java Temples & Volcanoes Tour
seo.intro_paragraph: Let Java and its volcanoes pierce cloud-wrapped mornings, then follow ancient temples where devotion remains alive. Cross Lombok and its Sasak villages, then return to Bali and its emerald rice terraces. Approach temples suspended from cliffs, then let the archipelago unfurl its Indonesian magic, raw and luminous.
seo.seo_hook: Volcanoes piercing clouds, terraced rice paddies rippling green, temples breathing devotion. Indonesia's sacred soul.

seo.h1_title: Borneo to Bali Expedition: Orangutans, Ancient Temples & Volcanic Landscapes
seo.intro_paragraph: Dive into Borneo's forests where orangutans roam freely beneath dense vibrant canopy. Reach Yogyakarta to feel the spiritual power of its UNESCO temples, watch Mount Bromo smoke at dawn, then unwind on Seminyak's lively beaches where Indonesia reveals its sharpest contrasts.
seo.seo_hook: Orangutans in emerald forest, temples breathing devotion, volcanoes smoking at dawn. Iconic Indonesia.

seo.h1_title: Borneo's Wild Coast: Kalimantan Jungles, River Safaris & Island Adventures
seo.intro_paragraph: Depart from Tarakan, gateway to Derawan's clear waters, then follow the Berau coast where reefs and beaches remain preserved. In Tanjung Redeb, fishing traditions and local life intersect, before reaching Maratua and its lagoons open to a peaceful sea horizon.
seo.seo_hook: Islands floating on perfect turquoise, coral reefs teeming with life, rivers carving through jungle. Eastern Kalimantan, hidden treasure.

seo.h1_title: Indonesia's Island Odyssey: Java Temples, Bali Beaches & Komodo Dragons
seo.intro_paragraph: Contemplate Borobudur rising from Java's misty plains, then let Bali unfurl sculpted rice terraces and dizzying temples. Approach Komodo and its volcanic islands, then glide to Nusa Lembongan and its crystalline waters. Volcanoes, spirituality and transparent sea answer one another.
seo.seo_hook: Buddhist temples emerging from mist, rice terraces cascading down, mythical dragons keeping watch. Java's volcanic epic.

seo.h1_title: Sulawesi, Indonesia Wonder: Coral Reefs, Tribal Culture and Volcanoes
seo.intro_paragraph: Explore Bunaken's seafloor, true coral gardens teeming with marine life, then enter Tangkoko forest where wildlife reveals itself at dawn. In the highlands of Tana Toraja, ceremonies honor ancestors, before reaching the Togean Islands and their calm shores bathed in blue.
seo.seo_hook: Coral gardens teeming with life, endemic species hiding in canopy, tribal rituals honoring ancestors. Sulawesi, exotic.

seo.h1_title: Borneo's Wild East: Kalimantan Orangutan Trekking & Derawan Island Diving
seo.intro_paragraph: Cross Kutai's rainforest, a silent refuge for orangutans beneath thick canopy, before reaching the Derawan archipelago and its translucent lagoons. Kakaban surprises with its saltwater lake of peaceful waters, then Banjarmasin reveals its canals and floating markets, the living heart of southern Borneo.
seo.seo_hook: Orangutans roaming free in forest, archipelagos with crystal seabeds, salt lakes shimmering in sun. Kalimantan, wild beauty.

seo.h1_title: North Sumatra Itinerary: Diving, Volcanoes and Tribal Culture
seo.intro_paragraph: This itinerary in northern Sumatra covers Aceh, Pulau Weh, volcanic highlands and traditional regions. It combines diving sites, mountain landscapes and Minangkabau cultural centers.
seo.seo_hook: Crystal-clear seabeds meet jungle-clad mountains, while traditional houses and markets keep ancestral cultures alive.

itineraries.title: Sumatra, Indonesia: Rainforests, Lake Toba & Tropical Island Hopping Itinerary

visits.text: Tjong A Fie Mansion - restored traditional Chinese residence of the wealthy merchant
Istana Maimoon - magnificent rococo-style palace built in 1888
Mesjid Raya (Grand Mosque) - largest mosque in the city built in 1906

activities.text: Exploration of historic buildings along Jalan Jendral A. Yani and Merdeka Square
Discovery of Chinese shops on Jalan A. Yani

visits.text: 3-hour journey from Medan to Gunung Leuser National Park via the Alas River valley
Arrival at Bukit Lawang - magnificent destination in the heart of the park

activities.text: Settlement and discovery of the orangutan sanctuary
Visit to the information center with slideshows about local wildlife

visits.text: Gunung Leuser National Park - 8000 km² park covered with dense jungle, UNESCO site
Bohorok Orangutan Centre - one-hour hike to observe orangutans

activities.text: Trek through lush tropical forests
Observation of orangutans, elephants, rhinoceros, sun bears, tigers and 500 bird species
Feeding of wild and semi-wild orangutans on the platforms

visits.text: Visit to nearby waterfalls

Tubing - relaxing river descent

Samosir - original homeland of the Bataks and the purest Toba Batak tribe
Boat-shaped carved tomb of King Sidabutar

activities.text: Observation of ritual buffalo sacrifice statues

activities.text: Discovery of the relaxed atmosphere and fresh mountain air

Exploration of the surrounding Minang highlands

activities.text: Immersion in the proud Minangkabau culture

visits.text: Padang - capital of West Sumatra, birthplace of Minang food

Rafflesia arnoldii - giant parasitic flower discovered by Raffles and Joseph Arnold

activities.text: Observation of rocks carved as armed warriors riding elephants
Discovery of figures fighting buffaloes or battling serpents

Megaliths, tombs, pillars and stone ruins dating from around 100 AD

seo.h1_title: Sumatra, Indonesia: Rainforests, Lake Toba & Tropical Island Hopping Itinerary
seo.intro_paragraph: Set out to meet Bukit Lawang's orangutans and watch them move through dense canopy, then follow the shores of Lake Toba, a vast volcanic expanse lined with island villages. The Mentawai Islands reveal tribal traditions that remain intact, while Padang asserts its port energy facing the ocean and anchors the western coast.
seo.seo_hook: Orangutans swinging through canopy, volcanoes framing the vast lake, tribal traditions carried on. Sumatra, wild island.
